title: When sequencing fails to pinpoint a rare disease

title_detail.value: When sequencing fails to pinpoint a rare disease

summary: Genomics fails to diagnose up to half of patients who are tested. Using a new neutrophil proteome database, researchers made genetic diagnoses for children with severe congenital neutropenia whom typical sequencing had failed.

summary_detail.value: Genomics fails to diagnose up to half of patients who are tested. Using a new neutrophil proteome database, researchers made genetic diagnoses for children with severe congenital neutropenia whom typical sequencing had failed.
